str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From meros; to part, i.e. to apportion, bestow, share, or to disunite, differ.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
